attributes.action: Stop the dangerous reopening of schools and children's nurseries on 1st June
attributes.additional_details: You are in charge the DfE have just told childcare providers to be ready to open from 1st June, we will be lucky to have any staff willing to come in never mind children. We CANNOT follow Government Guidance i.e. Social Distancing, we CANNOT secure a stable source of PPE so our staff will be at risk. We simply CANNOT risk assess for COVID. The only control measure open to us is TO REMAIN CLOSED. This brings the risk to Zero. Stop keep your orders in place to close schools and nurseries.
attributes.background: You told us you would only reopen schools if it was safe to do so, you are not breaking this promise. Do NOT risk the lives of children, staff and their families on this appalling course of action. Do NOT open the schools until absolutely safe to do so when we are at COVID Level ONE only!

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep schools closed until Covid 19 is no longer a threat: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316404

Stop opening nurseries until is safe to do so: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320957

Delay the reopening of schools to September: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318206 

Keep schools closed in the UK until an effective Cov-19 vaccine is available: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319292  

Shut schools completely to stop putting teachers, TAs and pupils at risk: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308013

No prosecution for parents that remove child from school during a pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300399

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
